intro: Appendicula reflexa var. neopommeranica, commonly known as the Neopommeranica appendicula, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in some areas.
